event.s:
While working with a women's hospital, UPMC Magee Women's, it was identified by the users there that certain complications following childbirth are not being captured in CCC.
The OB complications following childbirth:
Codes starting with 670: Major puerperal Infection following childbirth
Codes 671.3x: DVT antepartum
Codes 671.4x: DVT postpartum
Codes 673: Obstetrical Pulmonary Embolism
Codes 674.1x: Disruption of cesarean wound
Codes 674.2x: Disruption of perineal wound
Codes 674.2x: Hematoma, Hemorrhage of section wound
Codes 666: Post Partum Hemorrhage
Codes 667: Retained placenta without hemorrhage
There are other complications of pregnancy codes that would fall into the complication class but would not be considered a complication of the delivery. These codes are like pre-eclampsia, HTN, diabetes, etc. that are codes justifying a medical delivery prior to 39 weeks as listed by Joint Commission. They would be a POA=Y. These could be added to the "Complications of Condition" metric. These codes are included in the attached XLS file.
event.sChanges: Category changed from 'Inquiry' to 'Feature'. Status changed from 'Active' to 'New'. Added tag 'pm_umbrella'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Marilyn Agbeko by Marilyn Agbeko
event.sHtml:
While working with a women's hospital, UPMC Magee Women's, it was identified by the users there that certain complications following childbirth are not being captured in CCC.
 
 
The OB complications following childbirth:
Codes starting with 670: Major puerperal Infection following childbirth
Codes 671.3x: DVT antepartum
Codes 671.4x: DVT postpartum
Codes 673: Obstetrical Pulmonary Embolism
Codes 674.1x: Disruption of cesarean wound
Codes 674.2x: Disruption of perineal wound
Codes 674.2x: Hematoma, Hemorrhage of section wound
Codes 666: Post Partum Hemorrhage
Codes 667: Retained placenta without hemorrhage
 
There are other complications of pregnancy codes that would fall into the complication class but would not be considered a complication of the delivery. These codes are like pre-eclampsia, HTN, diabetes, etc. that are codes justifying a medical delivery prior to 39 weeks  as listed by Joint Commission. They would be a POA=Y. These could be added to the "Complications of Condition" metric. These codes are included in the attached XLS file.

event.s:
Some metrics do are not considers IsLowerBetter, as configured in our Measure Library e.g.
Vaginal Delivery with Previous C-Section (VBACs)
Vaginal Delivery with Previous C-Section (VBACs) (across uncomplicated deliveries)
This metric is not necessarily good or bad. The problem is that, in this case, physicians are seeing a red flag for a metric that is neutral, and it causes alarm.
The goal is to allow members to indicate metrics they would like to see but only in grey for neutral metrics of this sort.
event.sChanges: Category changed from 'Inquiry' to 'Feature'. Status changed from 'Active' to 'New'. Added tag 'pm_umbrella'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Marilyn Agbeko by Marilyn Agbeko
event.sHtml:
Some metrics do are not considers  IsLowerBetter, as configured in our Measure Library e.g.
Vaginal Delivery with Previous C-Section (VBACs)
Vaginal Delivery with Previous C-Section (VBACs) (across uncomplicated deliveries)
 
This metric is not necessarily good or bad. The problem is that, in this case, physicians are seeing a red flag for a metric that is neutral, and it causes alarm.
 
The goal is to allow members to indicate metrics they would like to see but only in grey for neutral metrics of this sort.

event.s: We have seen a lot of confusion from the users at th HCA Capital Division as well as others about the difference between the "Test" site and the "Production" site. Many users log into the Test site not know that they are there instead of in the production site. The idea would be to have a watermark across the background of the site on the login or home screen that says "TEST" so that users know that they are in the test site and NOT the production.
event.sChanges: Category changed from 'Inquiry' to 'Feature'. Status changed from 'Active' to 'New'. Added tag 'pm_umbrella'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Marilyn Agbeko by Marilyn Agbeko
event.sHtml: We have seen a lot of confusion from the users at th HCA Capital Division as well as others about the difference between the "Test" site and the "Production" site. Many users log into the Test site not know that they are there instead of in the production site. The idea would be to have a watermark across the background of the site on the login or home screen that says "TEST" so that users know that they are in the test site and NOT the production.

event.s: When creating access for a member to only be able to view one facility, other facilites show up under group profiles. The user only has access to the facility given to him/her however, the names of other facilites show up in the roster which makes this very confusing for the member. The goal of this project is to limit the list to only those to which the user has access.

event.s:
Starting with 2012.02 all custom OPPE records can be linked to the discharge explorer if the encounter number is provided at the record level. However, there is an issue with the data interpretation - the discharge explorer currently displays all encounters associated with that measure (numerator and denominator wherever applicable). It then becomes difficult to identify the fallouts for the measure.
The enhancement would be to add a section to the discharge explorer to show custom OPPE results for each metric. This section should also be available in the export to excel/csv function.
event.sChanges: Category changed from 'Inquiry' to 'Feature'. Status changed from 'Active' to 'New'. Added tag 'pm_umbrella'.
event.evtDescription: Assigned to Marilyn Agbeko by Marilyn Agbeko
event.sHtml:
Starting with 2012.02 all custom OPPE records can be linked to the discharge explorer if the encounter number is provided at the record level. However, there is an issue with the data interpretation - the discharge explorer currently displays all encounters associated with that measure (numerator and denominator wherever applicable). It then becomes difficult to identify the fallouts for the measure. 

The enhancement would be to add a section to the discharge explorer to show custom OPPE results for each metric. This section should also be available in the export to excel/csv function.

event.s:
Ability to select a single role for E-Review.
Member would like the ability to create an electronic review for just one role, not all three. If performing physician is selected in the focus setting of the report template, then they want the report to be just for when the physician is the performing physician. Or, they would want to be able to select just one role in the window where they select the template, date, initial status.

event.sHtml:
Ability to select a single role for E-Review.

Member would like the ability to create an electronic review for just one role, not all three. If performing physician is selected in the focus setting of the report template, then they want the report to be just for when the physician is the performing physician. Or, they would want to be able to select just one role in the window where they select the template, date, initial status.
